p: Finally, we modeled phenology and climatic suitability for E. postvittana in 2018 to provide insight into its potential voltinism, seasonal activities, and risk of invasion in particularly warm temperatures. The summer of 2018 in the United States was the warmest since 2012 and tied for the fourth-warmest on record (NOAA website https://www.noaa.gov/news/summer-2018-ranked-4th-hottest-on-record-for-us; last accessed 11/21/19). We generated a phenological event map that depicted the date of first egg laying by first generation females, because this activity is relevant to monitoring both eggs and the emergence of adults, which typically occurs two to three days prior to egg laying.
